title: GET OUT OF THAT TROLL GAME!!!
body:
This is just an idea and i would love to hear feedback from riot and other players! 

Okay, so how many of you have ever been in a champion select and that lovely troll  player comes out? I'm sure most all of you. its annoying when it happens and you get that pit feeling in your gut that this game is going to be horrible. Many of the players are fussing now and no one wants to play. unfortunately you are stuck here because leaving gives you time penalties and drops your points in ranked play or even worse counts as a loss for your promos. well this is an idea to help cut back on being trapped in troll gaming. 

The suggestion is that a surrender vote could be an option during champion select. Works just like the one in the game requiring a majority of the votes to end the game. This could help many players from being trapped into a miserable game due to one players sour attitude and game play. If the surrender vote is started and only 2 players vote yes then you are stuck to play or leave and take the penalties. 

I know this wont solve all the trolling but it is a good start to getting a better moral going with players in game and a nice nip towards some of the champion select issues occurring now.

replies.body:
Even if they seem to be trolls, most people would be reluctant to surrender since they still have a chance of winning even with the troll in their game. In my experience, people seldom surface as trolls/toxic players until something bad happens in game, whether it be a bad play, losing lane, etc.

With that out of the way, here's a scenario providing my above statement is horribly incorrect:

Let's say we have "less than optimal" example of synergy in champ select. Four players just can't get along for whatever reason. The fifth player is a minority who wants to stick it out. He's willing to cooperate and be positive but the other 4 can't seem to get along so they opt to surrender. Right from the start that optimistic minority was screwed and is going to lose LP/promos simply because he was unlucky. He didn't even have a chance to play in game. There would be no way to circumvent this as removing the surrender penalty would enable such a feature to be abused when one team is in a strategic disadvantage during champ select. Forgot to ban Rek'Sai and blue team first picked her? Entire team counterpicked? Bad team composition? "LOLSURRENDERGG"


Overall, I feel like this would just enable/encourage the tendency to give up early on. It's a serious optimism killer. I for one get somewhat pissed when a teammate gives up prematurely and completely demolishes team morale. What if a minority of the team attempts to surrender in champ select? We're already setting the mood right from the start. Those messages in the loading screen ("People who don't blame their teammates win 30% more games" or something like that) are there for a reason. Being subjected to this negativity or pessimism has drastic results on individual performance. Ideally, you want to go into the game with a clean slate with these new people you've just met and build the experience from there. First impressions are everything. Having a feature like this just sitting in front of us can so easily incite early conflict. "THIS IDIOT LOCKED IN *insert suboptimal champ/position* GG SURRENDER"



I've been sitting here for an hour trying to organize my jumbled mess of thoughts on this topic. Let me know if I made some of my arguments confusing or unclear.
i like what youre saying here and understood!
You've never had that game where the start trolling from the get go??? I 've had more than my share.
Oh trust me, I've been placed in bronze twice. I know the feels. I noticed it getting better midway through silver.

I never understood why Riot lets 2 No votes outweigh 3 yes votes in Surrendering.....you would think majority wins, right??? So many games I have had 2 trolls who knew each other and they troll team and vote no when we try to get out of it.
Yeah, 3/2 is majority and giving 2 people so much power when they're often using it to waste each other's time for additional griefing/arguing doesn't really make sense.
It is because the **majority** of players are happy with the current 4-1 system.

I would be in favour of the idea if it did not have potential negative effects for the team on the other side also in the champion select. What if they are getting along and have begun to discuss strategy and are synergising well? I don't think it's fair.

It's like in ARAM, when you get the champion you've been dying to get for the last week; you finally get it, and someone quits because they didn't get *their* champion. People seldom consider that they might be actually screwing someone else over with what seems like a harmless, good action for them.

Implementing an effective way to deal with pre-game trolls is important.  Most of the time, if one player dodges, you end up with the same group of people anyway, so if they treated it like this not much would change for the worse.

i know when people do dodge we end up 99% of the time with the same people. gives some advantage cause you can ban the champs that was currently selected for the opposing team as well. ive seen a lot of the time people troll extra hard to attempt to get someone to dodge due to a various amount of reasons.

Something really needs to be done about this, but if it comes to a surrender vote that won't really solve much.  Too many players click no 99% of the time and the other 1% they only need the slightest reason to change their mind.  The average league player really seems to think they're a main character of a story and will always win if they never give up :P

This is such a bad idea for so, so many reasons.  It would create way more fighting than it would solve, everyone thinks they know better than everyone else. 

I'm not sure how new you are to ranked but if you remember a season or two ago when you could ditch a ranked team in champ select with very little penalty it took 5 Queues to start a game because people would bail at the slightest hint of bad attitudes or bad team comps.  Solo Q is what it is, you're playing with a team of randoms, expect them to act like it.  If you don't wan't trolls play team 5s, you know how the game is meant to be played.

well that's why it would take a majority or otherwise take the penalties, im sure it would result is some abuse as all good things do. On the other hand most people are just as anxious as me to get into the game so not everyone would abuse the system.  to me, it would be nice to get out of the ridiculous games i get pinned into but that's got some to do with im not a hard core carrying player so without and team synergy it tends to fall apart. i do carry some games but i dont carry every game nor can i, so if i can find a way to better off my team from the start ill try too!
